item.title: Behind the scenes of drone food delivery in Finland
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: TechCrunch went behind the scenes of a three-party partnership between Irish drone delivery company Manna, Doordash-owned food delivery platform Wolt, and food startup Huuva.

item.title: Airbus orders software fix to thousands of planes due to solar radiation risk
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The company said it’s taking action because “analysis of a recent event involving an A320 Family aircraft has revealed that intense solar radiation may corrupt data critical to the functioning of flight controls.”

item.title: Black Friday sets online spending record of $11.8B, Adobe says
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: American consumers spent $11.8 billion online on Black Friday, according to data from Adobe Analytics, which says it tracks more than 1 trillion visits to U.S. retail websites.

item.title: New York state law takes aim at personalized pricing
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Businesses that use personalized pricing are now required to tell customers, “This price was set by an algorithm using your personal data."

item.title: No, you can’t get your AI to ‘admit’ to being sexist, but it probably is anyway
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Though LLMs might not use explicitly biased language, they may infer your demographic data and display implicit biases, researchers say.

item.title: VC Kara Nortman bet early on women’s sports, and now she’s creating the market
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: As women's sports enters what feels like a sustained boom period -- the Golden State Valkyries just played their first WNBA next season, the NWSL is expanding, media rights deals are growing -- Nortman remains cautiously optimistic about whether this moment will prove different from past surges in interest.

item.title: Supabase hit $5B by turning down million-dollar contracts. Here’s why.
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Vibe coding has taken the tech industry by storm, and it’s not just the Lovables and Replits of the world that are winning. The startups building the infrastructure behind them are cashing in too.  Supabase, the open-source database platform that’s become the backend of choice for the vibe-coding world, raised $100 million at a $5 billion valuation just months after closing $200 million at $2 billion. But co-founder and CEO […]

item.title: SoftBank stays in as Meesho $606M IPO becomes India’s first major e-commerce listing
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Meesho heads for India's first big e-commerce IPO next week.

item.title: How OpenAI and Google see AI changing go-to-market strategies
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: AI is changing how investors and startups bring their products to market. Three experts offered their insights at TechCrunch Disrupt.

item.title: The race to regulate AI has sparked a federal vs state showdown
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The fight over AI regulation isn't about the technology -- it's about whether Washington or the states get to set the rules, and what happens to consumers caught in between.

item.title: Best iPad apps to boost productivity and make your life easier
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: There are many iPad apps to help you organize recipes; sync tasks across devices; be more productive; and manage your notes.

item.title: Anduril’s autonomous weapons stumble in tests and combat, WSJ reports
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Defense tech startup Anduril Industries has faced numerous setbacks during testing of its autonomous weapons systems, according to new reporting by the WSJ.

item.title: This Thanksgiving’s real drama may be Michael Burry versus Nvidia
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Is Burry the canary in the coal mine, warning of a collapse that's inevitable? Or could his fame, his track record, his now unrestricted voice, and a fast-growing audience trigger the very implosion he's predicting?

item.title: Best iPad apps for unleashing and exploring your creativity
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: We’ve compiled a list of some of the best iPad apps for creativity that are available on the App Store.

item.title: Glīd won Startup Battlefield 2025 by building solutions to make logistics simpler, safer, and smarter
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Maggie Nye
item.description: We're excited to interview the winner of Startup Battlefield 2025, and Glid co-founder Kevin Damoa, on this week's Build Mode!

item.title: The future will be explained to you in Palo Alto
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: On Wednesday evening at PlayGround Global in Palo Alto, some very smart people who are building things you don’t understand yet will explain what’s coming. This is the final StrictlyVC event of 2025, and truly, the lineup is ridiculous. The series has traveled around the globe under the auspices of TechCrunch. Steve Case rented a […]

item.title: Nordic founders are taking bigger swings, and it’s paying off
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Ten years ago, raising €1 million in Copenhagen was enough to make waves in the region’s tech scene. Today, the Nordics are turning out billion-dollar companies like Lovable — which hit $200 million in revenue just 12 months after launching. Dennis Green-Lieber, founder of AI-powered customer intelligence platform Propane, has had a front-row seat to that shift […]

item.title: Here are the 49 US AI startups that have raised $100M or more in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Last year was monumental for the AI industry in the U.S. and beyond. How will 2025 compare?

item.title: JustiGuide wants to use AI to help people navigate the US immigration system
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The startup uses AI to help immigrants understand the system, connect with lawyers, and reduce associated costs.

item.title: OpenAI claims teen circumvented safety features before suicide that ChatGPT helped plan
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: In August, parents Matthew and Maria Raine sued OpenAI and its CEO, Sam Altman, over their 16-year-old son Adam's suicide, accusing the company of wrongful death. On Tuesday, OpenAI responded to the lawsuit with a filing of its own, arguing that it shouldn't be held responsible for the teenager's death.
